summary: An email from August 10, 2019, relaying two questions from defense counsel regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The questions concern who notified someone that Epstein's body was ready and who is assigned to run the FBI investigation for contact purposes.

persons.name: Mike Miller
persons.context: The email is addressed to Mike Miller, though his specific role is not defined in this text.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the email references that his body was ready, indicating his recent death.

events.title: Defense Counsel Inquiry Post-Epstein Death
events.description: Defense counsel poses two questions via email: one about who notified someone that Epstein's body was ready, and another about identifying the FBI investigation lead for contact.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 10, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 9-10, 2019.
Defense counsel is seeking information about who passed along the notification that 'Epstein's body is ready'.
Defense counsel is also seeking to identify the person assigned to run the FBI investigation for direct contact.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal and investigative procedures following Epstein's death.
